Comment: I mean, if you get past hyperbolic "His numbers should be zero!" and look at it objectively, some of these numbers should be seriously concerning for Trump and Republicans: 53% in Florida, 50% in Ohio, 49%(!) in Iowa...  Because, given how partisan times have gotten and the almost sports team mentality that voters have adopted, there's no way his numbers will ever get below 30%. Even Dubya only hit 27% towards the end and he was so unpopular that Republicans were distancing themselves from, or even out right disowning, him.
